revised_title: The Dispute between Keil and Leibnitz: A Historical Analysis
tldr: This article examines the historical dispute between Keil and Leibnitz regarding the invention of fluxions. It highlights the omission of additional members to the committee appointed to decide the dispute, which led to Newton appearing to assert a falsehood. The author also discusses the role of De Moivre in this controversy and the importance of the Royal Society's records for understanding the history of science.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > History of Science
